messages: 99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (17:08): wonders why the principles draft hasn't published yet
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:10): 99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e - because it's waiting on me to complete the publication request
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:11): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, I can do that for you, if needed...
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:15): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 - I think we also need to do a transition request for it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:15): meaning it needs to go to TimBL and chairs list
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:16): ah, yes, FPWD is more tricky
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:16): forgot
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:18): is looking at the status section of the document now

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:25): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 - any suggestions on text we can add to the Status of This Document section to preemptively respond to questions of the type that 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 Taylor (Webmaster) sent?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:25): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2007Nov/0216.html> May I respectfully ask on what basis you (Dan C) have
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:25): > therefore decided that 51 votes in favour represents
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:25): > the consensus that is required before publication may
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:25): > proceed ?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:25): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: you know some xslt, right?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:26): which response to above was http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2007Nov/0216.html
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:26): (or someone else here?)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:26): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef is in a meeting right nwo
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:26): I know a little xslt
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:26): do you know how http://simon.html5.org/test/xml/xml-stylesheet/support/transform.xml can be modified such that the <title> survives the transformation?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:26): looking now

99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e (17:27): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I've finished the translation btw. If the draft's gonna be published before friday, I can upload it and can blog about that.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:28): 99d799105c5630cb16b3a7b54e6ae26e - I plan to get it published before Friday
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:29): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - where do you want the title contents displayed? in the <p>The XSLT was applied.</p> output?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:30): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, why does that need to be included?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:31): He didn't really back up his arguments as far as I could tell
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:32): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: in <head><title>
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:32): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 - He incorrectly thought in order to publish we needed consensus and no formal objections on record
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:32): he also claimed that 34 did not agree to publish
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:32): I can imagine that others may think the same and might ask
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:32): 34 people
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:32): yeah, I know
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:33): 34 wasn't counting the hundreds of public invited experts
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:34): "There was no complete consensus within the HTML WG for publishing this document."
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:34): 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2, what was it counting? the other number was 31 or so (number of people who did not reply, not who disagreed)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:34): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: ^^
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:36): i wonder how publishing this doc and not publishing the html 5 doc will reflect on the HTML WG

78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (17:36): At the face to face meeting 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef said he was going to reach out to those who hadn't voted at all to make sure there were no serious objections...
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (17:36): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: Hmm, I see 33 names on the survey's non-responders list
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:37): k
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:37): maybe that's it then

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:38): it's not just "no serious objections"; I needed to check for explicit support; I didn't get enough. So on Friday, Chris and I announced that the HTML 5 spec publication question didn't carry
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:38): oops; the minutes for that meeting are now overdue. :-/
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:38): GR did his part; I just need to announce them
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:39): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - http://pastebin.com/mc91bcad
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:39): lemme know if that is what you need

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:40): meanwhile, I made yet another chairing error in the canvas/immediate-mode-graphics requirement survey: I didn't give separate options for "no" and "formally object"
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:40): and I didn't specify a quorum
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:40): someone told me that "formallly object" in a survey doesn't make sense
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:40): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: hmm, doesn't seem to work though
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:41): because you formally object to a resolution, not to a proposed resolution
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:41): no, you formally object to a proposed resolution. a formal objection is not an appeal mechanism
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:41): (this might be a bug in the process document)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:42): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - if you can send/paste a test document plus what your expected output is, I will try to make something that works
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:43): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: test document: http://simon.html5.org/test/xml/xml-stylesheet/xslt/001.xml
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:43): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: the expected output is basically s/not//
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:43): and perhaps remove any script blocks in head

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:43): these process details are perhaps worth some discussion, but the main point is: we really need the W3C member organizations participating in the WG to put their position on canvas on record this week
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:44): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - ah, in XHTML namespace
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:44): it would be nice if they simply participated in the WG from the start
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:44): "simply"?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:44): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - will paste a tweaked version in a second
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:44): instead of stalling the WG 6 months into the game
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:44): what's simple about connecting a huge organization like IBM with a huge organization like the W3C HTML WG?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:45): another chairing error: the survey deadline is during a holiday. :-/
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:46): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - http://pastebin.com/m1b5b7684
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:47): that one should work even if your source HTML is not in XHTML namespace
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:47): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef, seems that Nokia and Boeing are ok
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:47): and Google and Apple too
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (17:48): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: thanks, that worked (at least in opera)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:48): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 - cool. I feel now like I've actually accomplished something useful today :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:48): so time for me to get some sleep
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:49): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef, it's also not like HTML 5 is suddenly something new
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:57): yes, it is, to a lot of people, actually.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:57): Nokia responded? cool.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:57): I saw Boeing
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:58): I see Nokia among the non-responders in http://www.w3.org/2002/09/wbs/40318/req-gapi-canvas/results ; am I missing something, Anne?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:58): has an appointment in 2 minutes, fyi...
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:59): I did shift-reload... I guess I'll do it again...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (17:59): also, just doing this question for <canvas> doesn't help if Microsoft feels this applies to like 10 other features from HTML 5 too
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (17:59): excellent... consideration of performance on mobile platforms is now part of the decision record.
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:00): unless we want to take a couple of weeks for each of those
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:00): ...
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:00): notes that <canvas> works on Opera Mini :)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:00): I think a couple weeks for each major new requirement is worthwhile; we can parallelize some of it.
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:00): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: Not exactly with much animation or interactivity :-p
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:00): you have tested performance of canvas-based games in opera mini?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:01): Opera Mini doesn't do <canvas> games
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:01): Opera Mini didn't even support setInterval when I last tested it
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:01): that would make sense
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:01): (setTimeout works as long as you do it quickly enough)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (18:01): wishes for tests that show "Opera Mini doesn't do <canvas> games" and "<canvas> works on Opera Mini"

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:02): Opera Mini runs the normal Opera browser engine on a server somewhere, then sends a snapshot of the page to the client, so it's never going to do anything animated :-(
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:06): <canvas> sort of works on my iPod touch, but interactivity is difficult
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:07): I guess it would help if you had something like EventTargetArea = context.createInteractityArea(x,y,w,h)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:08): so the device knew what would be interactive and all
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (18:08): might also help with keyboard access

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:10): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: http://www.operamini.com/demo/?url=http://philip.html5.org/tests/canvas/suite/tests/2d.gradient.interpolate.multiple.html shows that static canvas works
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:11): (assuming it loads without timing out or having an error or anything like it normally does)

3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (18:24): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: http://www.operamini.com/demo/?url=http://canvex.lazyilluminati.com/misc/physics.html shows that interactive games don't work
